answers.answer: Hello,Chronic diarrhea can be due to parasitic infestations. Other causes are irritable bowel syndrome, celiac disease, crohn’s disease, malabsorption syndromes, pancreatic diseases, diabetes, hyperthyroidism etc. Diabetes can also cause diarrhea , so get its status checked by glycosylated hemoglobin which will reflect over all glucose control in past 3 months. Uncontrolled diabetes could be cause of diarrhea.It is very difficult to precisely confirm a diagnosis without examination and investigations and the answer is based on the medical information provided. For exact diagnosis, you are requested to consult your doctor. I sincerely hope that helps. Take care and please do keep me posted on how you are doing.

question: Hello,This is for my 59 year old mother who has been experiencing chronic diarrhea for the past 10 years. It all started with her first colonoscopy 10 years ago, and then she had another one about 3 years ago and it has become very bad. She eats pretty normal, nothing special or horrible, but also just standard. There is nothing really cut out of her diet, but she also is not eating buckets of ice cream. She has no idea what is wrong, and doctors also seem to be stunned. She has tried probiotics  and added fiber, but that is not doing anything. I was not sure if it could be IBS or Colitis, or maybe diabetes? She is not a large large lady, probably about 135 and 5'4. Any thoughts would be appreciated!
title: Chronic Diarrhea
